title: What is the maximum size a black hole can reach, and what happens then? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is no known upper limit at all. There was a paper quite recently though that showed one interesting upper limit for the mechanisms of Black Hole growth. The normal method is by accretion, matter that comes closer than a certain distance starts to spiral in (Innermost Stable Circular Orbit, ISCO). But that only works if the object truly crosses below that distance (which is even direction-dependant…). Or on passing gas clouds, if their self-gravity is weaker than the tidal forces of the Black Hole. That limit is still a bit uncertain, but it seems to be around 70 billion solar masses iirc. From there on, only direct infall can feed a Black Hole. It will still grow, but that growth will be somewhat slower.

There is no known upper limit. This is filler text to appease the Quora moderation bot.
